page.title: 02L.STAUGHTON CHURCHES
page.content: The most prominent and ancient building is the 14th century {Parish {Church of All Saints.}It is built in the Decorated and Perpendicular styles and consists of a chancel,nave,south aisle and porch, and an embattled west tower of four stages with octagonal spire of which the upper part was destroyed by lightning in 1901 and rebuilt in 1910. It is relieved by dormers and contains five bells. It can accomodate 250 persons. {The Baptist Chapel}was built in 1957 and accomodates 150 people.The original chapel ,opened in 1766 and large enough to accomodate 500 people, was demolished in 1944 to make way for building the Airfield. Both Church and Chapel are lovingly maintained by the villagers who share cleaning and flower arranging duties and give generously to their upkeep.
